name: Zab Bite - Thai E-Sarn Cuisine
address: Zab Bite - Thai E-Sarn Cuisine, 4197 Fraser St, Vancouver, BC V5V 4E9

featured_reviews.review_id: From all the social media influencers and reading all the reviews, I had high expectations for this new restaurant. I ordered only their recommended dishes - pork toast, stir-fry basil, and boat noodles. The pork toast was very disappointing. There was barely any pork on the toast, like 95% bread and 5% pork. It just tasted like oily bread. Boat noodles were awful. Noodles were congealed. I couldn't even separate it in the hot soup. I am questioning the freshness of their noodles. Was it cooked a head of time hours ago? Soup was bland. Salt and lots of oil. Meat pieces were tough and chewy. The stir fry basil dish was solid and was the best out of the 3 dishes I ordered. Overall, there are better Thai restaurants that are way more affordable.

Was it cooked a head of time hours ago? Soup was bland. Salt and lots of oil. Meat pieces were tough and chewy. The stir fry basil dish was solid and was the best out of the 3 dishes I ordered. Overall, there are better Thai restaurants that are way more affordable.
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text:
Hi Mila, 

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback about your recent visit to our restaurant. We genuinely appreciate your honesty and regret to hear that your experience did not meet your expectations.

At Zab Bite, we are committed to providing high-quality, fresh meals to our valued guests. We genuinely appreciate your understanding and hope that you might consider giving us another opportunity to provide you with a more positive dining experience.

Zab Bite Team

featured_reviews.review_id:
One of the latest Thai restaurants to open in Vancouver serving north eastern Thai dishes.

Visited in October and enjoyed some lunch special including the Royal Pad Thai with veggie spring rolls and the Khao Pad Kra Pao Tray which is their holy basil stir fry dish served with crispy toast topped with minced pork.

Their pad Thai comes with a sweet and sour type of sauce (not sure if it was tamarind but it didn't really taste like other tamarind sauces I've had before).

I liked that they asked how spicy we wanted the khao pad kra pao (and specified the difference between Thai spice level vs western spice level). We picked the medium Thai spice level which wasn't excessively spicy but the heat does grow as you continue to eat.

Overall, tasty food. Also liked the Thai lemon tea and cha yen (Thai yes with condensed milk). Would really like to come back to try their curry dish.

Update: Returned in mid-November and tried their appetizer platter, tom yum, green curry chicken, and drunken noodles. They were much busier on this visit (guess the word had gotten out). Loved the translucent noodles in the drunken noodle dish and the green curry rice was amazing. The tom yum soup was spicy and chock full of ingredients. And we enjoyed the items in the platter (crispy pork toast, veggie spring rolls, shrimp wrap, and pork jerky).

featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Penny, Thank you for sharing your delightful experience at Zab Bite! We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed the food and our service. If you ever have specific comments or suggestions to help us improve, please don't hesitate to reach out to us at info.zabbite@gmail.com

featured_reviews.review_id: Went there 3 times!! Still so surprised how authentic these dishes are! If you are looking for the original spice level of Thai food, this is the place for you. I love all the salad dishes that remind me of my hometown. Wish the portion are a bit bigger!!
featured_reviews.review_text: Went there 3 times!! Still so surprised how authentic these dishes are! If you are looking for the original spice level of Thai food, this is the place for you. I love all the salad dishes that remind me of my hometown. Wish the portion are a bit bigger!!

featured_reviews.review_id:
This Thai restaurant is amazing!! Food and staff exceeds expectations. Authentic taste and many unique dishes.
Definitely coming back soon!
Highly recommend the crispy shrimp toast and the mango sticky rice.
featured_reviews.review_text:
This Thai restaurant is amazing!! Food and staff exceeds expectations. Authentic taste and many unique dishes.
Definitely coming back soon!
Highly recommend the crispy shrimp toast and the mango sticky rice.
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you very much for the fantastic review, and we are glad to hear that you had an amazing experience dining in at Zab Bite. We hope to see you again soon!

featured_reviews.review_id: Amazing service & food! Loved how they come and really check up on you. They are really open to feedback as they are soft opening and Sean was super welcoming. My favourite is the crying tiger, especially the Chili sauce  the sticky mango is also very tasty, with the balance of crunchiness and softness. Really good lunch promo going on right now so I'll definitely be back!
featured_reviews.review_text: Amazing service & food! Loved how they come and really check up on you. They are really open to feedback as they are soft opening and Sean was super welcoming. My favourite is the crying tiger, especially the Chili sauce  the sticky mango is also very tasty, with the balance of crunchiness and softness. Really good lunch promo going on right now so I'll definitely be back!
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text:
Thank you very much for the fantastic review! We're thrilled to hear that you had an amazing experience at our establishment and enjoyed our service and food.

Can't wait to serve you again soon!

Zab Bite Team

featured_reviews.review_id: Authentic, delicious, flavorful Thai food.   We visited during their soft opening and we were not disappointed.  The green curry was so flavorful and rich.   The mango sticky rice dessert was also very tasty.   Definitely would recommend.   Dishes were customized to accommodate our food allergies too.
featured_reviews.review_text: Authentic, delicious, flavorful Thai food.   We visited during their soft opening and we were not disappointed.  The green curry was so flavorful and rich.   The mango sticky rice dessert was also very tasty.   Definitely would recommend.   Dishes were customized to accommodate our food allergies too.

featured_reviews.review_id: Cozy little gem that serves up the best Thai food I've had in Vancouver yet! Service is equally as warm and welcoming and was very helpful with suggestions and accommodations on their menu. I highly recommended the crying tiger, pad se ew and boat noodle; thick noodles are a must. Definitely give this place a try if you're looking for authentic Thai food!
featured_reviews.review_text: Cozy little gem that serves up the best Thai food I've had in Vancouver yet! Service is equally as warm and welcoming and was very helpful with suggestions and accommodations on their menu. I highly recommended the crying tiger, pad se ew and boat noodle; thick noodles are a must. Definitely give this place a try if you're looking for authentic Thai food!
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you very much for the fantastic review! We are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed the food, see you again soon!

featured_reviews.review_id:
My friends and I had the pleasure of dining at Zab Bite restaurant, a gem of a Thai restaurant in town. From the moment we stepped in, the ambiance set the stage for what was an unforgettable evening. The decor, an elegant blend of traditional Thai elements and modern touches, created a welcoming and lively atmosphere.

The service was exceptional. Our server was knowledgeable, attentive, and had great suggestions for our diverse group. We started with Assorted Appetizers, Veggie spring rolls, crispy pork toast, shrimp wrap, and pork jerky. Each dish was a hit, perfectly balanced in flavors and textures.

The main courses were a delightful journey through Thai cuisine. The green curry with chicken was rich and aromatic, with just the right level of spice. The Pad Thai was simply the best I've ever had, with a perfect blend of sweet, sour, and great flavors. We also tried a lesser-known dish, Khao Soi, which was a revelation with its creamy coconut curry and tender noodles.

What truly made the night special was the shared joy of exploring these flavors with friends. The portions were generous, ideal for sharing, and it sparked lively conversations and shared laughter. To end the meal, we indulged in mango sticky rice and Thai iced tea, which were the perfect sweet notes to conclude a fantastic meal.

In summary, Zab Bite restaurant is not just about extraordinary Thai food; it's about the experience of sharing delicious, well-crafted dishes with good company in a beautiful setting. It's a must-visit for anyone looking to enjoy Thai cuisine at its best. A solid 5 stars for the amazing food, ambiance, and service. Can't wait to return!
